conclusion: Consider principles of refraction and total internal reflection.
Light bends away from the normal when traveling from higher to lower refractive index.
Total internal reflection occurs if angle of incidence is greater than critical angle.
Critical angle calculation: sin(θc) = n_air / n_glass.
Light source must be positioned so angle of incidence is less than critical angle.
Light source should be close to center to avoid reaching critical angle.
Maximum angle θ for no total internal reflection is when incidence angle equals critical angle.
Conclusion: Light source must be within distance R/n from center.
